doc.previous: The Mersey is considered sacred by British Hindus and worshipped in a similar way to the River Ganges Festival of Immersion ceremonies are held annually on the river in which clay figures representing the Hindu Lord Ganesha the elephant deity riding a mouse are submerged in the river from a ferry boat Followers throw flowers pictures and coins into the river 27 28
doc.after: From its lowest point moving upstream tributaries of the Mersey include
